issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Project appears to successfully build but doesn't launch in the emulator, I get the same error when trying to build for device. This issue was here in 5.1.2 and now still in 5.2.0. However I used to be able to build fine and now getting this error.

[INFO]  Copying results back to project build directory
[INFO]  Finished building the application in 1m 30s 928ms
[INFO]  Finished building the application in 1m 30s 938ms
[INFO]  Installing and launching the application
[INFO]  Project built successfully in 1m 31s 20ms

[WARN]  error while updating tiapp data with appc platform:
[WARN]  error while updating tiapp data with appc platform:
2016-02-24T11:33:32.675Z | ERROR  | An uncaught exception was thrown!
Callback was already called.
2016-02-24T11:33:32.679Z | ERROR  | Callback was already called.
fields.summary: CLI: Error when building for Windows Phone

comments.body:
Hello,

Thanks for your report. What do you get when you run the app through terminal? Use below command and let us know.

appc run -p windows -T wp-emulator

Regards

PR here: https://github.com/appcelerator/appc-cli-titanium/pull/154
It looks like just a missing final callback for the first function in async.parallel.
But I can't test as our windows system is not set up properly yet.

Verified as fixed, No error was shown When building. 
Tested on:
Nokia Lumia 928 (8.1) 
Windows Simulator (8.1) 
Microsoft Lumia 640 (10) 
Windows Simulator (10) 
Windows 10 
Ti SDK: 5.3.0.v20160421080259 
Appc NPM: 4.2.5-3 
App CLI: 5.3.0-36 
Node v4.4.3 
*Closing Ticket.*
